content.text:
Good question â€” API costs add up fast with AI assistants. Here's how we can keep this lean:

## ðŸŽ¯ Smart Strategies

### 1. **Use Cheaper Models for Simple Stuff**
- I'm currently on **Claude Sonnet 4.5** (premium/expensive)
- For basic chat, summaries, simple tasks â†’ switch to **Haiku** or **GPT-4o-mini** (way cheaper)
- Keep Sonnet for complex work only
- You can set a session-level override with `/model haiku` or similar

### 2. **Keep Messages Concise**
- Shorter prompts = fewer tokens = lower cost
- I'll be brief unless you need detail
- You do the same when possible

### 3. **Turn Off Heartbeats** (already done âœ…)
- Your HEARTBEAT.md is empty = no periodic checks = no wasted API calls
- Only add tasks there when you actually need them

### 4. **Batch Work**
- Instead of 10 small conversations throughout the day, batch questions
- One longer session is more efficient than many short ones

### 5. **Skip Unnecessary Tool Calls**
- I won't search memory or files unless truly needed
- If I already know the answer, I'll just answer

### 6. **Use Sub-Agents Sparingly**
- Spawning background agents costs extra
- Only for truly complex/long-running tasks

## ðŸ’° Immediate Action

Want me to switch to a cheaper model right now? I can use:
- **Haiku** (Claude's cheapest, still very capable)
- **GPT-4o-mini** (OpenAI's budget option)

Or keep Sonnet but just be mindful? What's your budget comfort zone?

update.checkOnStart.label: Update Check on Start
update.checkOnStart.help: Check for npm updates when the gateway starts (default: true).

diagnostics.flags.label: Diagnostics Flags
diagnostics.flags.help: Enable targeted diagnostics logs by flag (e.g. ["telegram.http"]). Supports wildcards like "telegram.*" or "*".

diagnostics.cacheTrace.enabled.label: Cache Trace Enabled
diagnostics.cacheTrace.enabled.help: Log cache trace snapshots for embedded agent runs (default: false).

diagnostics.cacheTrace.filePath.label: Cache Trace File Path
diagnostics.cacheTrace.filePath.help: JSONL output path for cache trace logs (default: $OPENCLAW_STATE_DIR/logs/cache-trace.jsonl).

diagnostics.cacheTrace.includeMessages.label: Cache Trace Include Messages
diagnostics.cacheTrace.includeMessages.help: Include full message payloads in trace output (default: true).

diagnostics.cacheTrace.includePrompt.label: Cache Trace Include Prompt
diagnostics.cacheTrace.includePrompt.help: Include prompt text in trace output (default: true).

diagnostics.cacheTrace.includeSystem.label: Cache Trace Include System
diagnostics.cacheTrace.includeSystem.help: Include system prompt in trace output (default: true).

agents.list.*.identity.avatar.label: Identity Avatar
agents.list.*.identity.avatar.help: Agent avatar (workspace-relative path, http(s) URL, or data URI).

gateway.remote.url.label: Remote Gateway URL
gateway.remote.url.help: Remote Gateway WebSocket URL (ws:// or wss://).

gateway.remote.sshTarget.label: Remote Gateway SSH Target
gateway.remote.sshTarget.help: Remote gateway over SSH (tunnels the gateway port to localhost). Format: user@host or user@host:port.

gateway.remote.sshIdentity.label: Remote Gateway SSH Identity
gateway.remote.sshIdentity.help: Optional SSH identity file path (passed to ssh -i).

gateway.remote.tlsFingerprint.label: Remote Gateway TLS Fingerprint
gateway.remote.tlsFingerprint.help: Expected sha256 TLS fingerprint for the remote gateway (pin to avoid MITM).

gateway.auth.token.label: Gateway Token
gateway.auth.token.help: Required by default for gateway access (unless using Tailscale Serve identity); required for non-loopback binds.

tools.exec.applyPatch.enabled.label: Enable apply_patch
tools.exec.applyPatch.enabled.help: Experimental. Enables apply_patch for OpenAI models when allowed by tool policy.

tools.exec.applyPatch.allowModels.label: apply_patch Model Allowlist
tools.exec.applyPatch.allowModels.help: Optional allowlist of model ids (e.g. "gpt-5.2" or "openai/gpt-5.2").

tools.exec.notifyOnExit.label: Exec Notify On Exit
tools.exec.notifyOnExit.help: When true (default), backgrounded exec sessions enqueue a system event and request a heartbeat on exit.

tools.exec.pathPrepend.label: Exec PATH Prepend
tools.exec.pathPrepend.help: Directories to prepend to PATH for exec runs (gateway/sandbox).

tools.exec.safeBins.label: Exec Safe Bins
tools.exec.safeBins.help: Allow stdin-only safe binaries to run without explicit allowlist entries.

tools.message.allowCrossContextSend.label: Allow Cross-Context Messaging
tools.message.allowCrossContextSend.help: Legacy override: allow cross-context sends across all providers.

tools.message.crossContext.allowWithinPr.label: Allow Cross-Context (Same Provider)
tools.message.crossContext.allowWithinPr.help: Allow sends to other channels within the same provider (default: true).

tools.message.crossContext.allowAcrossPr.label: Allow Cross-Context (Across Providers)
tools.message.crossContext.allowAcrossPr.help: Allow sends across different providers (default: false).

tools.message.crossContext.marker.enable.label: Cross-Context Marker
tools.message.crossContext.marker.enable.help: Add a visible origin marker when sending cross-context (default: true).

tools.web.search.enabled.label: Enable Web Search Tool
tools.web.search.enabled.help: Enable the web_search tool (requires a provider API key).

tools.web.search.apiKey.label: Brave Search API Key
tools.web.search.apiKey.help: Brave Search API key (fallback: BRAVE_API_KEY env var).

tools.web.search.maxResults.label: Web Search Max Results
tools.web.search.maxResults.help: Default number of results to return (1-10).

tools.web.search.timeoutSeconds.label: Web Search Timeout (sec)
tools.web.search.timeoutSeconds.help: Timeout in seconds for web_search requests.

tools.web.search.cacheTtlMinutes.label: Web Search Cache TTL (min)
tools.web.search.cacheTtlMinutes.help: Cache TTL in minutes for web_search results.

tools.web.fetch.enabled.label: Enable Web Fetch Tool
tools.web.fetch.enabled.help: Enable the web_fetch tool (lightweight HTTP fetch).

tools.web.fetch.timeoutSeconds.label: Web Fetch Timeout (sec)
tools.web.fetch.timeoutSeconds.help: Timeout in seconds for web_fetch requests.

tools.web.fetch.cacheTtlMinutes.label: Web Fetch Cache TTL (min)
tools.web.fetch.cacheTtlMinutes.help: Cache TTL in minutes for web_fetch results.

tools.web.fetch.userAgent.label: Web Fetch User-Agent
tools.web.fetch.userAgent.help: Override User-Agent header for web_fetch requests.

gateway.controlUi.basePath.label: Control UI Base Path
gateway.controlUi.basePath.help: Optional URL prefix where the Control UI is served (e.g. /openclaw).

gateway.controlUi.allowInsecureAuth.label: Allow Insecure Control UI Auth
gateway.controlUi.allowInsecureAuth.help: Allow Control UI auth over insecure HTTP (token-only; not recommended).

gateway.controlUi.dangerouslyDisableDevi.label: Dangerously Disable Control UI Device Auth
gateway.controlUi.dangerouslyDisableDevi.help: DANGEROUS. Disable Control UI device identity checks (token/password only).

gateway.reload.mode.label: Config Reload Mode
gateway.reload.mode.help: Hot reload strategy for config changes ("hybrid" recommended).

gateway.reload.debounceMs.label: Config Reload Debounce (ms)
gateway.reload.debounceMs.help: Debounce window (ms) before applying config changes.

gateway.nodes.browser.mode.label: Gateway Node Browser Mode
gateway.nodes.browser.mode.help: Node browser routing ("auto" = pick single connected browser node, "manual" = require node param, "off" = disable).

gateway.nodes.browser.node.label: Gateway Node Browser Pin
gateway.nodes.browser.node.help: Pin browser routing to a specific node id or name (optional).

gateway.nodes.allowCommands.label: Gateway Node Allowlist (Extra Commands)
gateway.nodes.allowCommands.help: Extra node.invoke commands to allow beyond the gateway defaults (array of command strings).

gateway.nodes.denyCommands.label: Gateway Node Denylist
gateway.nodes.denyCommands.help: Commands to block even if present in node claims or default allowlist.

nodeHost.browserProxy.enabled.label: Node Browser Proxy Enabled
nodeHost.browserProxy.enabled.help: Expose the local browser control server via node proxy.

nodeHost.browserProxy.allowProfiles.label: Node Browser Proxy Allowed Profiles
nodeHost.browserProxy.allowProfiles.help: Optional allowlist of browser profile names exposed via the node proxy.

agents.defaults.repoRoot.label: Repo Root
agents.defaults.repoRoot.help: Optional repository root shown in the system prompt runtime line (overrides auto-detect).

agents.defaults.bootstrapMaxChars.label: Bootstrap Max Chars
agents.defaults.bootstrapMaxChars.help: Max characters of each workspace bootstrap file injected into the system prompt before truncation (default: 20000).

agents.defaults.envelopeTimezone.label: Envelope Timezone
agents.defaults.envelopeTimezone.help: Timezone for message envelopes ("utc", "local", "user", or an IANA timezone string).

agents.defaults.envelopeTimestamp.label: Envelope Timestamp
agents.defaults.envelopeTimestamp.help: Include absolute timestamps in message envelopes ("on" or "off").

agents.defaults.envelopeElapsed.label: Envelope Elapsed
agents.defaults.envelopeElapsed.help: Include elapsed time in message envelopes ("on" or "off").

agents.defaults.memorySearch.label: Memory Search
agents.defaults.memorySearch.help: Vector search over MEMORY.md and memory/*.md (per-agent overrides supported).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.sources.label: Memory Search Sources
agents.defaults.memorySearch.sources.help: Sources to index for memory search (default: ["memory"]; add "sessions" to include session transcripts).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.extraPaths.label: Extra Memory Paths
agents.defaults.memorySearch.extraPaths.help: Extra paths to include in memory search (directories or .md files; relative paths resolved from workspace).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.experimenta.label: Memory Search Session Index (Experimental)
agents.defaults.memorySearch.experimenta.help: Enable experimental session transcript indexing for memory search (default: false).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.remote.base.label: Remote Embedding Base URL
agents.defaults.memorySearch.remote.base.help: Custom base URL for remote embeddings (OpenAI-compatible proxies or Gemini overrides).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.remote.apiK.label: Remote Embedding API Key
agents.defaults.memorySearch.remote.apiK.help: Custom API key for the remote embedding provider.

agents.defaults.memorySearch.remote.head.label: Remote Embedding Headers
agents.defaults.memorySearch.remote.head.help: Extra headers for remote embeddings (merged; remote overrides OpenAI headers).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.remote.batc.label: Remote Batch Concurrency
agents.defaults.memorySearch.remote.batc.help: Max concurrent embedding batch jobs for memory indexing (default: 2).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.fallback.label: Memory Search Fallback
agents.defaults.memorySearch.fallback.help: Fallback provider when embeddings fail ("openai", "gemini", "local", or "none").

agents.defaults.memorySearch.local.model.label: Local Embedding Model Path
agents.defaults.memorySearch.local.model.help: Local GGUF model path or hf: URI (node-llama-cpp).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.store.vecto.label: Memory Search Vector Index
agents.defaults.memorySearch.store.vecto.help: Enable sqlite-vec extension for vector search (default: true).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.store.vecto.label: Memory Search Vector Extension Path
agents.defaults.memorySearch.store.vecto.help: Optional override path to sqlite-vec extension library (.dylib/.so/.dll).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.sync.onSear.label: Index on Search (Lazy)
agents.defaults.memorySearch.sync.onSear.help: Lazy sync: schedule a reindex on search after changes.

agents.defaults.memorySearch.sync.sessio.label: Session Delta Bytes
agents.defaults.memorySearch.sync.sessio.help: Minimum appended bytes before session transcripts trigger reindex (default: 100000).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.sync.sessio.label: Session Delta Messages
agents.defaults.memorySearch.sync.sessio.help: Minimum appended JSONL lines before session transcripts trigger reindex (default: 50).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.query.hybri.label: Memory Search Hybrid
agents.defaults.memorySearch.query.hybri.help: Enable hybrid BM25 + vector search for memory (default: true).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.query.hybri.label: Memory Search Vector Weight
agents.defaults.memorySearch.query.hybri.help: Weight for vector similarity when merging results (0-1).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.query.hybri.label: Memory Search Text Weight
agents.defaults.memorySearch.query.hybri.help: Weight for BM25 text relevance when merging results (0-1).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.cache.enabl.label: Memory Search Embedding Cache
agents.defaults.memorySearch.cache.enabl.help: Cache chunk embeddings in SQLite to speed up reindexing and frequent updates (default: true).

agents.defaults.memorySearch.cache.maxEn.label: Memory Search Embedding Cache Max Entries

auth.profiles.label: Auth Profiles
auth.profiles.help: Named auth profiles (provider + mode + optional email).

auth.order.label: Auth Profile Order
auth.order.help: Ordered auth profile IDs per provider (used for automatic failover).

auth.cooldowns.billingBackoffHours.label: Billing Backoff (hours)
auth.cooldowns.billingBackoffHours.help: Base backoff (hours) when a profile fails due to billing/insufficient credits (default: 5).

auth.cooldowns.billingBackoffHoursByProv.label: Billing Backoff Overrides
auth.cooldowns.billingBackoffHoursByProv.help: Optional per-provider overrides for billing backoff (hours).

agents.defaults.models.label: Models
agents.defaults.models.help: Configured model catalog (keys are full provider/model IDs).

agents.defaults.model.fallbacks.label: Model Fallbacks
agents.defaults.model.fallbacks.help: Ordered fallback models (provider/model). Used when the primary model fails.

agents.defaults.imageModel.primary.label: Image Model
agents.defaults.imageModel.primary.help: Optional image model (provider/model) used when the primary model lacks image input.

agents.defaults.humanDelay.minMs.label: Human Delay Min (ms)
agents.defaults.humanDelay.minMs.help: Minimum delay in ms for custom humanDelay (default: 800).

agents.defaults.humanDelay.maxMs.label: Human Delay Max (ms)
agents.defaults.humanDelay.maxMs.help: Maximum delay in ms for custom humanDelay (default: 2500).

agents.defaults.cliBackends.label: CLI Backends
agents.defaults.cliBackends.help: Optional CLI backends for text-only fallback (claude-cli, etc.).

commands.native.label: Native Commands
commands.native.help: Register native commands with channels that support it (Discord/Slack/Telegram).

commands.nativeSkills.label: Native Skill Commands
commands.nativeSkills.help: Register native skill commands (user-invocable skills) with channels that support it.

commands.text.label: Text Commands
commands.text.help: Allow text command parsing (slash commands only).

commands.bash.label: Allow Bash Chat Command
commands.bash.help: Allow bash chat command (`!`; `/bash` alias) to run host shell commands (default: false; requires tools.elevated).

commands.bashForegroundMs.label: Bash Foreground Window (ms)
commands.bashForegroundMs.help: How long bash waits before backgrounding (default: 2000; 0 backgrounds immediately).

commands.config.label: Allow /config
commands.config.help: Allow /config chat command to read/write config on disk (default: false).

commands.debug.label: Allow /debug
commands.debug.help: Allow /debug chat command for runtime-only overrides (default: false).

commands.restart.label: Allow Restart
commands.restart.help: Allow /restart and gateway restart tool actions (default: false).

session.dmScope.label: DM Session Scope
session.dmScope.help: DM session scoping: "main" keeps continuity; "per-peer", "per-channel-peer", or "per-account-channel-peer" isolates DM history (recommended for shared inboxes/multi-account).

session.agentToAgent.maxPingPongTurns.label: Agent-to-Agent Ping-Pong Turns
session.agentToAgent.maxPingPongTurns.help: Max reply-back turns between requester and target (0â€“5).

messages.ackReaction.label: Ack Reaction Emoji
messages.ackReaction.help: Emoji reaction used to acknowledge inbound messages (empty disables).

messages.inbound.debounceMs.label: Inbound Message Debounce (ms)
messages.inbound.debounceMs.help: Debounce window (ms) for batching rapid inbound messages from the same sender (0 to disable).

channels.whatsapp.label: WhatsApp
channels.whatsapp.help: works with your own number; recommend a separate phone + eSIM.

channels.telegram.customCommands.label: Telegram Custom Commands
channels.telegram.customCommands.help: Additional Telegram bot menu commands (merged with native; conflicts ignored).

channels.telegram.dmPolicy.label: Telegram DM Policy
channels.telegram.dmPolicy.help: Direct message access control ("pairing" recommended). "open" requires channels.telegram.allowFrom=["*"].

channels.telegram.streamMode.label: Telegram Draft Stream Mode
channels.telegram.streamMode.help: Draft streaming mode for Telegram replies (off | partial | block). Separate from block streaming; requires private topics + sendMessageDraft.

channels.telegram.draftChunk.minChars.label: Telegram Draft Chunk Min Chars
channels.telegram.draftChunk.minChars.help: Minimum chars before emitting a Telegram draft update when channels.telegram.streamMode="block" (default: 200).

channels.telegram.draftChunk.maxChars.label: Telegram Draft Chunk Max Chars
channels.telegram.draftChunk.maxChars.help: Target max size for a Telegram draft update chunk when channels.telegram.streamMode="block" (default: 800; clamped to channels.telegram.textChunkLimit).

channels.telegram.draftChunk.breakPrefer.label: Telegram Draft Chunk Break Preference
channels.telegram.draftChunk.breakPrefer.help: Preferred breakpoints for Telegram draft chunks (paragraph | newline | sentence). Default: paragraph.

channels.telegram.retry.attempts.label: Telegram Retry Attempts
channels.telegram.retry.attempts.help: Max retry attempts for outbound Telegram API calls (default: 3).

channels.telegram.retry.minDelayMs.label: Telegram Retry Min Delay (ms)
channels.telegram.retry.minDelayMs.help: Minimum retry delay in ms for Telegram outbound calls.

channels.telegram.retry.maxDelayMs.label: Telegram Retry Max Delay (ms)
channels.telegram.retry.maxDelayMs.help: Maximum retry delay cap in ms for Telegram outbound calls.

channels.telegram.retry.jitter.label: Telegram Retry Jitter
channels.telegram.retry.jitter.help: Jitter factor (0-1) applied to Telegram retry delays.

channels.telegram.network.autoSelectFami.label: Telegram autoSelectFamily
channels.telegram.network.autoSelectFami.help: Override Node autoSelectFamily for Telegram (true=enable, false=disable).

channels.telegram.timeoutSeconds.label: Telegram API Timeout (seconds)
channels.telegram.timeoutSeconds.help: Max seconds before Telegram API requests are aborted (default: 500 per grammY).

channels.whatsapp.dmPolicy.label: WhatsApp DM Policy
channels.whatsapp.dmPolicy.help: Direct message access control ("pairing" recommended). "open" requires channels.whatsapp.allowFrom=["*"].

channels.whatsapp.selfChatMode.label: WhatsApp Self-Phone Mode
channels.whatsapp.selfChatMode.help: Same-phone setup (bot uses your personal WhatsApp number).

channels.whatsapp.debounceMs.label: WhatsApp Message Debounce (ms)
channels.whatsapp.debounceMs.help: Debounce window (ms) for batching rapid consecutive messages from the same sender (0 to disable).

channels.signal.dmPolicy.label: Signal DM Policy
channels.signal.dmPolicy.help: Direct message access control ("pairing" recommended). "open" requires channels.signal.allowFrom=["*"].

channels.imessage.dmPolicy.label: iMessage DM Policy
channels.imessage.dmPolicy.help: Direct message access control ("pairing" recommended). "open" requires channels.imessage.allowFrom=["*"].

channels.bluebubbles.dmPolicy.label: BlueBubbles DM Policy
channels.bluebubbles.dmPolicy.help: Direct message access control ("pairing" recommended). "open" requires channels.bluebubbles.allowFrom=["*"].

channels.discord.dm.policy.label: Discord DM Policy
channels.discord.dm.policy.help: Direct message access control ("pairing" recommended). "open" requires channels.discord.dm.allowFrom=["*"].

channels.discord.retry.attempts.label: Discord Retry Attempts
channels.discord.retry.attempts.help: Max retry attempts for outbound Discord API calls (default: 3).

channels.discord.retry.minDelayMs.label: Discord Retry Min Delay (ms)
channels.discord.retry.minDelayMs.help: Minimum retry delay in ms for Discord outbound calls.

channels.discord.retry.maxDelayMs.label: Discord Retry Max Delay (ms)
channels.discord.retry.maxDelayMs.help: Maximum retry delay cap in ms for Discord outbound calls.

channels.discord.retry.jitter.label: Discord Retry Jitter
channels.discord.retry.jitter.help: Jitter factor (0-1) applied to Discord retry delays.

channels.discord.maxLinesPerMessage.label: Discord Max Lines Per Message
channels.discord.maxLinesPerMessage.help: Soft max line count per Discord message (default: 17).

channels.discord.intents.presence.label: Discord Presence Intent
channels.discord.intents.presence.help: Enable the Guild Presences privileged intent. Must also be enabled in the Discord Developer Portal. Allows tracking user activities (e.g. Spotify). Default: false.

channels.discord.intents.guildMembers.label: Discord Guild Members Intent
channels.discord.intents.guildMembers.help: Enable the Guild Members privileged intent. Must also be enabled in the Discord Developer Portal. Default: false.

channels.discord.pluralkit.enabled.label: Discord PluralKit Enabled
channels.discord.pluralkit.enabled.help: Resolve PluralKit proxied messages and treat system members as distinct senders.

channels.discord.pluralkit.token.label: Discord PluralKit Token
channels.discord.pluralkit.token.help: Optional PluralKit token for resolving private systems or members.

channels.slack.dm.policy.label: Slack DM Policy
channels.slack.dm.policy.help: Direct message access control ("pairing" recommended). "open" requires channels.slack.dm.allowFrom=["*"].

channels.slack.allowBots.label: Slack Allow Bot Messages
channels.slack.allowBots.help: Allow bot-authored messages to trigger Slack replies (default: false).

channels.slack.thread.historyScope.label: Slack Thread History Scope
channels.slack.thread.historyScope.help: Scope for Slack thread history context ("thread" isolates per thread; "channel" reuses channel history).

channels.slack.thread.inheritParent.label: Slack Thread Parent Inheritance
channels.slack.thread.inheritParent.help: If true, Slack thread sessions inherit the parent channel transcript (default: false).

channels.mattermost.botToken.label: Mattermost Bot Token
channels.mattermost.botToken.help: Bot token from Mattermost System Console -> Integrations -> Bot Accounts.

channels.mattermost.baseUrl.label: Mattermost Base URL
channels.mattermost.baseUrl.help: Base URL for your Mattermost server (e.g., https://chat.example.com).

channels.mattermost.chatmode.label: Mattermost Chat Mode
channels.mattermost.chatmode.help: Reply to channel messages on mention ("oncall"), on trigger chars (">" or "!") ("onchar"), or on every message ("onmessage").

channels.mattermost.requireMention.label: Mattermost Require Mention
channels.mattermost.requireMention.help: Require @mention in channels before responding (default: true).

agents.list[].identity.avatar.label: Agent Avatar
agents.list[].identity.avatar.help: Avatar image path (relative to the agent workspace only) or a remote URL/data URL.

discovery.mdns.mode.label: mDNS Discovery Mode
discovery.mdns.mode.help: mDNS broadcast mode ("minimal" default, "full" includes cliPath/sshPort, "off" disables mDNS).

plugins.allow.label: Plugin Allowlist
plugins.allow.help: Optional allowlist of plugin ids; when set, only listed plugins load.

plugins.deny.label: Plugin Denylist
plugins.deny.help: Optional denylist of plugin ids; deny wins over allowlist.

plugins.load.paths.label: Plugin Load Paths
plugins.load.paths.help: Additional plugin files or directories to load.

plugins.slots.label: Plugin Slots
plugins.slots.help: Select which plugins own exclusive slots (memory, etc.).

plugins.slots.memory.label: Memory Plugin
plugins.slots.memory.help: Select the active memory plugin by id, or "none" to disable memory plugins.

plugins.entries.help: Per-plugin settings keyed by plugin id (enable/disable + config payloads).

plugins.entries.*.enabled.help: Overrides plugin enable/disable for this entry (restart required).

plugins.entries.*.config.label: Plugin Config
plugins.entries.*.config.help: Plugin-defined config payload (schema is provided by the plugin).

plugins.installs.label: Plugin Install Records
plugins.installs.help: CLI-managed install metadata (used by `openclaw plugins update` to locate install sources).

plugins.installs.*.spec.label: Plugin Install Spec
plugins.installs.*.spec.help: Original npm spec used for install (if source is npm).

plugins.installs.*.sourcePath.help: Original archive/path used for install (if any).

plugins.installs.*.version.label: Plugin Install Version
plugins.installs.*.version.help: Version recorded at install time (if available).

tools.web.search.perplexity.apiKey.help: Perplexity or OpenRouter API key (fallback: PERPLEXITY_API_KEY or OPENROUTER_API_KEY env var).

tools.web.search.perplexity.baseUrl.help: Perplexity base URL override (default: https://openrouter.ai/api/v1 or https://api.perplexity.ai).

tools.web.fetch.readability.help: Use Readability to extract main content from HTML (fallbacks to basic HTML cleanup).

tools.web.fetch.firecrawl.enabled.help: Enable Firecrawl fallback for web_fetch (if configured).

tools.web.fetch.firecrawl.baseUrl.help: Firecrawl base URL (e.g. https://api.firecrawl.dev or custom endpoint).

tools.web.fetch.firecrawl.onlyMainConten.help: When true, Firecrawl returns only the main content (default: true).

tools.web.fetch.firecrawl.maxAgeMs.help: Firecrawl maxAge (ms) for cached results when supported by the API.

tools.web.fetch.firecrawl.timeoutSeconds.help: Timeout in seconds for Firecrawl requests.

channels.msteams.configWrites.help: Allow Microsoft Teams to write config in response to channel events/commands (default: true).
